page.title: 19THE VILLAGE OF OAKAMOOR
page.content: Steep hills, which cause havoc in the snow, lead down to Oakamoor which nestles beside the River Churnet.The village has not grown much since the heyday of Bolton's Copper Works,with very little post-war housing,just a few council houses and old people's bungalows, forestry commission houses and private houses.Some houses have been sold as holiday homes.The larger houses around Oakamoor belonged to the Bolton family.Moor Court,until recently used as a woman's open prison is now owned privately and converted into flats.A prison building has become an Old People's Home and provides employment for some local people. Lightoaks Hall is for sale by the last of the Boltons living in the village. The Trinty Church,built in 1832 shares a vicar with the parishes of Alton and Freehay.The Free Church is very active
